intro: Heuffelia laevigata, commonly known as the smooth heuffelia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are smooth and lance-shaped. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Heuffelia laevigata is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and wetlands.
